<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
A student suggests that the rate of cooling is lower when the temperature of the water is lower.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 665, 135]]<|/det|>
State and explain whether the results support this suggestion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 211, 920, 228]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 241, 920, 274]]<|/det|>
The student states that most of the thermal energy lost by the water in the can is by evaporation from the water surface.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 288, 920, 321]]<|/det|>
Another student states that most of the thermal energy lost by the water in the can is by conduction through the sides of the can.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 335, 779, 352]]<|/det|>
The students repeat the experiment twice to investigate the two statements.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 804, 383]]<|/det|>
Suggest **one** suitable addition to the apparatus for **each** additional experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|> A student investigates the force required to break different beams made from a mixture of sand and cement. All the beams have the same cross-section. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 714, 136]]<|/det|> Plan an experiment to investigate the force required to break the beams. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 149, 332, 166]]<|/det|> Fig. 4.1 shows the set-up. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[176, 175, 819, 272]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 286, 532, 304]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 317, 420, 335]]<|/det|> The following apparatus is available: <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 350, 143, 365]]<|/det|>
a selection of beams made from different ratios of sand and cement and of various lengths
triangular blocks to support the beams
a metre rule
a selection of loads.
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 425, 907, 443]]<|/det|> You can also use other apparatus and materials that are usually available in a school laboratory. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 457, 920, 490]]<|/det|> The student takes all the necessary safety precautions. You are **not** required to write about safety precautions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 323, 521]]<|/det|> In your plan, you should: <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 535, 120, 552]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 534, 920, 567]]<|/det|> explain briefly how to carry out the investigation (you may add to the diagram if it helps your explanation) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 581, 138, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 581, 487, 599]]<|/det|> state the key variables to keep constant <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 612, 128, 630]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 612, 920, 644]]<|/det|> draw a table, or tables, with column headings, to show how to display your readings (you are **not** required to enter any readings in the table) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 658, 138, 676]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 658, 675, 676]]<|/det|> explain how you would use the readings to reach a conclusion.
